javadoc: DataComponent provides Data and CodeUnit access to Struct and Array components. NOTE!! DataComponents only have a unique key within its parent Struct/Array. This places a constraint on the use of the key field and getKey() method on the underlying classes CodeUnitDB and DataDB. The CodeUnit key should only be used for managing an object cache.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: address
params.comment: the address of the data component

params.name: parent
params.comment: the DataDB object that contains this component.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address of the data component

params.name: parent
params.comment: the DataDB object that contains this component.

params.name: offset
params.comment: the offset of this component within its parent.

Get the name of this Data that is a component of another
 Data Item.

         and null if this is not a component of another prototype.

 parent.

methods.comment:
Get the offset of this Data item from the start of its immediate

methods.name: getComponentIndex
methods.comment: Get the index of this Data item within its parent

return.comment:
the index of this component in its parent
         returns -1 if this is not a component

name: DataComponent
comment:
DataComponent provides Data and CodeUnit access to Struct and Array components.

 NOTE!! DataComponents only have a unique key within its parent Struct/Array.  This places a constraint on
 the use of the key field and getKey() method on the underlying classes CodeUnitDB and DataDB.
 The CodeUnit key should only be used for managing an object cache.
